perturbation.original_text: Such fee will be computed daily and payable monthly by Nationwide within thirty (30) days of receipt from you of a valid invoice (in excel format) that identifies, for each CUSIP of each Fund, the number of sub-accounts, participants or beneficial shareholders serviced by you and such other information as may be necessary to validate the fee payable.
perturbation.changed_text: Such fee will be computed daily and payable quarterly by Nationwide within ninety (90) days of receipt from you of a valid invoice (in excel format) that identifies, for each CUSIP of each Fund, the number of sub-accounts, participants or beneficial shareholders serviced by you and such other information as may be necessary to validate the fee payable.
perturbation.explanation: This change alters the payment terms to be paid quarterly instead of monthly and paid out in ninety (90) days instead of thirty (30) days which is in contradiction to general standards of quick payments. These standards make sure the payments are given in a timely manner.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) and state wage and hour laws.

perturbation.original_text: You agree to transmit the requested information that is on your books and records to the Fund or its designee promptly, but in any event not later than five (5) business days, after receipt of a request.
perturbation.changed_text: You agree to transmit the requested information that is on your books and records to the Fund or its designee whenever it is possible, but in any event not later than fifteen (15) business days, after receipt of a request.
perturbation.explanation: The modification extends the period for submitting shareholder information from five to fifteen business days, potentially conflicting with SEC Rule 22c-2, which requires prompt cooperation in addressing market timing or excessive trading. This delay may hinder the Fund's ability to efficiently monitor and mitigate risks associated with such activities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: SEC Rule 22c-2 under the Investment Company Act of 1940

perturbation.original_text: You agree to execute instructions as soon as reasonably practicable, but not later than five business days after your receipt of the instructions.
perturbation.changed_text: You agree to execute instructions at your earliest convenience, but not later than fifteen business days after your receipt of the instructions.
perturbation.explanation: The modification extends the period for executing instructions from five to fifteen business days after their receipt. This delay conflicts with Rule 22c-2, which dictates that the fund, or a financial intermediary, act promptly upon request by the fund's adviser. Extending the execution timeframe to 15 days may be an issue if that execution impacts an investors position in the fund.
